subject: RE: [junit] Re: problems installing junit
msgSnippet: I ve just taken a quick look at my jUnit installation, and I have seen that the sample classes don t come bundled in the jar.  Therefore, you must include the
messageBody:
I've just taken a quick look at my jUnit installation, and I have seen
that the sample classes don't come bundled in the jar. Therefore, you
must include the sample classes separately.

Try the following:
set classpath=c:\junit\junit.jar;c:\junit\

Manuel Amago.
mailto:mamago@...

> -----Original Message-----
> From: thesenselessuk [mailto:rj.payne@...]
> Sent: 11 January 2002 11:14
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: problems installing junit
>
>
> How do I added the directory to the classpath??
>
> I have tried variations on:
> set classpath=c:\junit\junit.jar; c:\junit\junit\samples\
> but still get the 'class not found' in the gui's status bar.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> --- In junit@y..., Mark Meyers <markm@m...> wrote:
> > 1. try: java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> > without ".class"
> >
> > 2. add the unzipped directory to the classpath (they're not in the
> > junit.jar)
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: thesenselessuk [mailto:rj.payne@v...]
> > Sent: vrijdag 11 januari 2002 11:48
> > To: junit@y...
> > Subject: [junit] problems installing junit
> >
> >
> > Hi
> >
> > I am having problems getting the Junit installation tests to work.
> >
> >
> > I have unzipped the zip file to the c drive and junit.jar is in c:
> > \junit\junit.jar
> >
> >
> > The classpath jas been set, so when I inspect it using 'set
> > classpath' the
> > correct junit.jar path is printed in dos window:
> > C:\>java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests.class
> > Class not found "junit.samples.AllTests.class"
> >
> >
> > I think that the jar file is found becase of this:
> > C:\>java junit.textui.TestRunner
> > Usage: TestRunner [-wait] testCaseName, where name is the name of
> the
> > TestCase class
> >
> >
> >
> > However When I try to run any of the TestRunner files I get:
> > C:\>java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests.class
> > Class not found "junit.samples.AllTests.class"
> >
> >
> > If somebody could tell me what stupid mistake I am making I would
> be
> > very grateful.
> > Thanks,
> > Richard Payne
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
